p: Most of the FGD participants agreed that alcohol consumption was very high and is one of the potential drivers for HIV infection among youth, both directly and indirectly. Alcohol is freely available and there are no restrictions on access based on age category or opening and closing hours for bars. Respondents mentioned that in the schools, both teachers and students drink alcohol and end up in bars where they are exposed to high risk sex, and as a respondent in northern Uganda mentioned, this may be facilitated when schools are very close to bars and disco halls.
